results.title: Sabrina: friends forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Chuck Grimes, DIC Entertainment and Scott Heming
results.brief_description: Feature length animated TV movie version of “Sabrina” the animated series, based on the live-action sitcom. Sabrina, a teenage witch, prepares for boarding school and attends witch academy, to learn about potions and spells, but Sabrina’s secret origins (half-human, half-witch), set her apart from her peers, from whom she fears ostracizing. Overwhelmed by her new environment, Sabrina is impressed by the snooty attitude and wealth of fellow student, Portia, whose acquaintances accept Sabrina but are unaware of her half-witch status. When Sabrina befriends another half-witch Nicole, a girl spurned by the in-group, and the pair aid each other’s transition into witch-hood, the kind-hearted Sabrina learns the perils of slavish conformity in order to belong. Academy rules are that a witch is true to her friends, true to herself and uses magic wisely, themes which the narrative supports through Sabrina’s at school experiences. This film, suitable for children and pitched at teens and pre-teens, has an endearing comic tone that supports the funky neo-feminist values of ‘girl power’.

results.title: Sabrina = Sabrina fair
results.brief_description: Linus and David Larrabee are the two sons of a very wealthy Long Island family. Linus is all work, while David is all playboy. Meanwhile, Sabrina Fairchild is the young, shy, awkward daughter of the family’s chaffeur, who has been infatuated with David all her life. After a two year absence in Paris, Sabrina returns an elegant, sophisticated and beautiful woman. Suddenly, she finds that she has finally captured David’s attention, but as she does so, she finds herself falling in love with Linus, and he with her. Cast includes: Humphrey Bogart, Audrey Hepburn, William Holden and Walter Hampden.

results.title: Saboteur [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Frank Lloyd Productions and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Barry Kane, a Los Angeles aircraft factory worker witnesses his plant’s firebombing at the hands of a Nazi agent. During the blast his best friend is killed, and to heighten the tragedy Kane is wrongly accused of sabotage when it is discovered that the extinguisher Kane handed him was filled with an accelerant. In a desperate effort to clear his name, Kane begins a relentless cross country chase that traverses Boulder Dam, New York’s Radio City Music Hall, and culminates at the Statue of Liberty. This was Hitchcock’s first film to feature an all American cast. Stars Priscilla Lane, Robert Cummings, Otto Kruger, Alan Baxter, Clem Bevans, Norman Lloyd and Alma Kruger. Original screenplay by Peter Viertel, Joan Harrison and Dorothy Parker. Cinematography by Joseph Valentine.

results.title: Sabotage = A Woman alone
results.creator_credit: Gaumont, Sir Michael Balcon, Ivor Montagu and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: The lights fail in a local cinema and the angry audience harass the young woman in the ticket box. Her husband, the cinema manager, will soon become the focus of an investigation into political sabotage on a grand scale - a plan to rob the entire city of electricity. This early Hitchcock classic, based on Joseph Conrad’s “The secret agent”, stars Sylvia Sydney, Oscar Homolka and Jon Loder. The video also includes outtakes from Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, the shower scene, which Hitchcock explains.

results.title: S.T.O.P. Surviving Time outside Prison
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, SKA TV and Campbell Manderson
results.brief_description: Awareness-raising report on the plight of ex-prisoners of Deer Park correctional facility to secure adequate support for women who have been released from prison. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: S.S. British Sovereign
results.brief_description: Story of a British tanker from the drawing board through the shipyards to the high seas. Ship-building sequences at the Barrow-in-furnace yards in the north of England show extensive use of prefabricated methods and the film includes the launching, fitting-out and trial scenes.

results.title: S.P.L.A.S.H.
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Mills and Judy LeGros
results.brief_description: This fast-paced and entertaining animated film is about water and the demands placed on our waterways by agriculture, industry, and urban life. An army of droplets, led by The Chief, shows what happens to water from the time it falls as rain until it reaches its destination.

results.title: S.O.S.: save our sons
results.creator_credit: Elisa Argenzio, Rebecca McLean and S O S Pictures Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: The gaoling of the ‘Fairlea Five’ was the first many Australians had heard of the Save our Sons movement; a group of women formed in the sixties to protest against the Vietnam War. S.O.S explores the motivation of this group of women, charting their progress from their unpopular beginnings in 1965, to the moratoriums and re-election of the Labour Party in 1972. The film uses interviews, original footage and news clippings to illustrate their strategies (both conventional and non-conventional), specific areas of protest (including anti-conscription and conscientious objecting), and their achievements over this time.
